thanks to you and your spam, another company gets placed on my blacklist

Q: Table layout adjusting insides of components A:

Hah how true. Take care of all data, events and logic inside that class, but display the components into the target Container where the GridBagLayout is.

Actually, I could even use that trick with already existing Containers: The class even COULD inherit from JPanel, and even have the Components added into its GUI, but later on add these Components to the target panel, as Swing will simply remove them from their old parents.

Q: is there anyway to convert from Double to BigInteger? A:

Actually using BigDecimal.valueOf isn't correct. One has to use new BigDecimal(..) instead. Try following code in jshell`:

import java.math.*;
var big = BigInteger.valueOf(2).pow(70); # big ==> 1180591620717411303424
var d = big.doubleValue();
BigDecimal.valueOf(d).toBigIntegerExact(); # yields 1180591620717411300000
new BigDecimal(d).toBigIntegerExact(); # yields 1180591620717411303424

Subtle difference that matters from time to time...

Q: R sscanf equivalent A:

Do you mean conversion or convertation rather than conversation? Look for scan function.

Q: VBA Run Macro and Screen Tip (or Tool Tip) From Shape. I cannot get the code I found to work A:

You could consider using an approach where you use the hyperlink to call the macro, instead of assigning a separate macro to the onAction of the shape.

Here's a quick example:

Sub Tester()
    'set up some buttons
    With ActiveSheet
        AddMacroAndPopUp .Shapes("Rectangle 1"), "Test1", "popup 1"
        AddMacroAndPopUp .Shapes("Rectangle 2"), "Test2", "popup 2"
    End With
End Sub

'utility sub to configure a shape with a link and some pop-up text
Sub AddMacroAndPopUp(shp As Shape, macroName, txt As String)
    Dim ws As Worksheet
    shp.Parent.Hyperlinks.Add Anchor:=shp, Address:="#" & macroName & "()", ScreenTip:=txt
End Sub

'Example functions called from hyperlinks
'**************************************************
Function Test1()
    Debug.Print "Test1"
    Range("A1") = Now      'do something here
    Set Test1 = Selection  '<< must return a "destination" for the link,
                           '      in this case the clicked shape
End Function

'called from hyperlink
Function Test2()
    Debug.Print "Test2"
    Range("A2") = Now      'do something here
    Set Test2 = Selection
End Function
'**************************************************

Important note: The methods called by the hyperlinks need to be functions, and they need to return a destination for the link to navigate to: I used (eg) Set Test1 = Selection and that worked fine for me. All the posted code was in one regular code module.
